summary: A letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to defense counsel in the Ghislaine Maxwell case, providing a non-exhaustive list of Bates-numbered discovery materials relevant to a newly identified minor victim (Minor Victim-4) referenced in a superseding indictment. The letter is designated as confidential under a protective order.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss

events.title: Protective Order Issued
events.description: A protective order was issued in the Ghislaine Maxwell case, governing the handling of confidential discovery materials.

events.title: Return of Superseding Indictment S2
events.description: A superseding indictment (S2 20 Cr. 330) was returned, adding new allegations, including those related to Minor Victim-4.

keyFacts: The document is a confidential government letter providing defense counsel with Bates-numbered discovery materials related to a newly identified 'Minor Victim-4' in the superseding indictment against Ghislaine Maxwell.
The list of Bates ranges (e.g., SDNY_GM_00165560) is explicitly stated to be non-exhaustive and provided as a courtesy to help the defense identify relevant materials.
The letter is governed by a Protective Order dated July 31, 2020, and is itself designated as 'confidential' due to containing information from records under that order.
The document reveals the ongoing discovery process in the Maxwell case, with the government proactively identifying evidence pertaining to new charges in a superseding indictment.
The birth year of Minor Victim-4 is mentioned but redacted in the provided text, indicating the sensitive nature of the victim's identity.
